shrimp.name: KubelkaMunk
shrimp.description: Kubelka-Munk model for the composition of layered surfaces.
shrimp.author: rconstruct

input.name: thicklayer
input.description: Reflectivity value of infinitely thick layer

shrimp.usage: Based on Matt Pharr's implementation of the Kubelka-Munk model, for the composition of layered surfaces. SigmaA is the attenuation coefficient of the paint layer, describing the differential attenuation per distance travelled in the medium, while SigmaS represents the scattering coefficient of the paint layer - as light travels in the medium, it's scattered to differnet direction, some of this scattered light eventually exits the medium, with the color of the particles it interacted with. Both SigmaA and SigmaS are estimated according to the reflectance value of an infinitely thick layer, set with the parameter thicklayer. See SIGGRAPH 2001 course notes, "Advanced RenderMan 3: Render Harder", for notes and background information. This block passes the resulting values to the aov_surfacecolor, aov_diffuse, aov_specularcolor and aov_specular AOV presets.
